item.title: l
item.dc:creator: @Pandora7 Pandora7
item.description:
@Pandora7 wrote:

code

[code]*two handed weapon check
**/
public boolean is2handed(String itemName, int itemId) {
if(itemName.contains(“ahrim”) || itemName.contains(“karil”) || itemName.contains(“verac”) || itemName.contains(“guthan”) || itemName.contains(“dharok”) || itemName.contains(“torag”)) {
return true;
}
if(itemName.contains(“longbow”) || itemName.contains(“shortbow”) || itemName.contains(“ark bow”)) {
return true;
}
if(itemName.contains(“crystal”) || itemName.contains(“maul”) || itemName.contains(“cannon”)) {
return true;
}
if (itemName.contains(“Primal 2h sword”)) {
return false;
}
if (itemName.contains(“godsword”) || itemName.contains(“claw”) || itemName.contains(“aradomin sword”) || itemName.contains(“bronze 2h”) || itemName.contains(“iron 2h”) || itemName.contains(“steel 2h”) || itemName.contains(“black 2h”) || itemName.contains(“mithril 2h”) || itemName.contains(“adamant 2h”) || itemName.contains(“rune 2h”) || itemName.contains(“spear”)) {
return true;
}
if (itemName.contains(“zaryte”)) {
return true;
}
switch(itemId) {
case 6724: // seercull
case 11730:
case 4153:
case 6528:
case 10887:
case 14484:

                    return true;
                    case 16909:
                    return false;
            }
   
            return false;
    }

/**
* Weapons special bar, adds the spec bars to weapons that require them
* and removes the spec bars from weapons which don't require them
**/[/code]

item.title: l
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

wrong spot just undo that and save and recompile then change your is2handed boolean with mine.

Here’s my whole is2handed boolean. So yeah copy over everything in your itemassistant.java from public boolean is2handed to the last } that is above the addSpecialBar void

[code]public boolean is2handed(String itemName, int itemId) {
if(itemName.contains(“ahrim”) || itemName.contains(“karil”) || itemName.contains(“verac”) || itemName.contains(“guthan”) || itemName.contains(“dharok”) || itemName.contains(“torag”)) {
return true;
}
if(itemName.contains(“longbow”) || itemName.contains(“shortbow”) || itemName.contains(“ark bow”)) {
return true;
}
if(itemName.contains(“crystal”) || itemName.contains(“maul”) || itemName.contains(“cannon”)) {
return true;
}
if (itemName.contains(“Primal 2h sword”)) {
return false;
}
if (itemName.contains(“godsword”) || itemName.contains(“claw”) || itemName.contains(“aradomin sword”) || itemName.contains(“bronze 2h”) || itemName.contains(“iron 2h”) || itemName.contains(“steel 2h”) || itemName.contains(“black 2h”) || itemName.contains(“mithril 2h”) || itemName.contains(“adamant 2h”) || itemName.contains(“rune 2h”) || itemName.contains(“spear”)) {
return true;
}
if (itemName.contains(“zaryte”)) {
return true;
}
switch(itemId) {
case 6724: // seercull
case 11730:
case 4153:
case 6528:
case 10887:
case 14484:

		return true;
		case 16909:
		return false;
	}

	return false;
}[/code]

in the old code it made any item with 2h in it 1 handed and that’s not good for your cause

u got error cause ur case did not have a switch for it so it wouldn’t make sense.

btw u said primal 2h b, that’s code 16137 according to item.cfg

also: what i did made every primal 2h 1 handed, to fix that just go in the part where it says itemName.contains("Primal 2h sword") to itemName.contains("Primal 2h sword (b)")

i just downloaded the client and cache to test it and it all works.

Read full topic

item.title: l
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

kk i got it.

go to itemassistant.java in server.model.items package

go to line 1400 (in eclipse, click the navigate tab then go to line or in notepad++ just scroll down to line 1400)

then look in the code below the boolean is2handed

you will see a switch for itemId
so now under return true; add

case 16909: return false;
save, then compile

if this dont work just post. and i strongly recommend eclipse ide if you don’t have it because it’s really useful

edit: also what this did was just make it so the item id 16909 is false for the is2handed boolean (booleans are always true or false)
